page.title: 11RUGBY PORTLAND CEMENT.
page.content: The Rugby Portland Cement P.L.C.began in Rugby in 1825.The firm makes cement using chalk,limestone and clay which are extracted from quarries.Their products are tranported by their own fleets of road and rail tankers.They have 2763 people working for them in the U.K.and 473 people overseas.In their Northern region they have works at South Ferriby and depots at Leeds, Manchester and Sandiacre,in the Eastern region they have a works at Barrington,in the Midlands,at Birmingham,Rugby,and Southam,in the South West,at Gloucester,Bristol, Chinnor and Southampton and in the South,at Tilbury,Greater London, Rochester and Lewes.The headquarters in Rugby is at Crown House.The only traffic on the former Leamington to Rugby Railway line is that needed for the Rugby-Southam Cement Works.
